channel.title: Research Fellows on Chao ZHOU
channel.description: Recent content in Research Fellows on Chao ZHOU

item.title: Hanxiao WANG
item.description: My Info Currently, I am a Research Fellow at National University of Singapore, working with the Department of Mathematics. My research focuses on stochastic control, stochastic analysis and mathematical finance. I received my Ph.D. in 2020 at Fudan University (in China) on my thesis about backward stochastic Volterra integral equations and stochastic linear-quadratic optimal control problems. Before I started my Ph.D. program, I had received a Bachelor degree in Jilin University (in China).

item.title: Huafu LIAO
item.description: My Info I am currently a Research Fellow in National University of Singapore. My research interests are in credit risk, optimal porfolio selection with regime switching, and neural network. I received my Ph.D Degree in Mathematics from University of Science and Technology of China in 2019. My Ph.D thesis studies a class of dynamical models on credit portfolio with regime-switching and default contagion, utilizing recursive HJB system and BSDE with jumps.

item.title: Yiqi GU
item.description: Bio Currently, I am a Research Fellow at National University of Singapore, working with the Department of Mathematics. My research focuses on deep learning-based methods for partial differential equations. I received my Ph.D. in 2019 at Purdue University (in US) on my thesis about spectral methods for PDEs in complex domains. Before I started my Ph.D. program, I had received a Bachelor degree in Zhejiang University (in China) and a Master degree in University of Washington (in US).

item.title: Guanxing FU
item.description: Bio I am an Assistant Professor in The Hong Kong Polytechnic University, see my website Previously, I was a Research Fellow in National University of Singapore. Here I was working on mean field games, stochastic control and mathematical finance. I obtained my PhD degree from Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin in 2018. My PhD thesis focuses on mean field games arising in optimal portfolio liquidation, mean field games with singular controls as well as BSPDEs.
